title: Chef De Piece, ca. 1815
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave
inscribed: Stamp at the end of one length bearing half of the Oberkampf factory mark in use from 1792 to 1815. Also in brown: D600 Monumens de Paris (within box), 17, BIOPG, 24. In red: 24(6)BL and DL. Handwritten in ink (very faded): 600 DNG.
provenance: formerly in the collection of Elinor merrell where it was No. 6 on her list of chefs de piece.
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 84 x 132 cm (33 1/16 x 51 15/16 in.)
Repeat H: 52 cm (20 1/2 in.)
description: Design in pale brown on white background. Four familiar scenes of Paris: statue of Henri IV on the Pont Neuf, the Fountain of the Innocents, the Parthenon, the east front of the Louvre all in elaborate frames.

tombstone.epitaph:
Chef De Piece, ca. 1815.
ca. 1815. Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-3.
